q: Star Press MUNCIE, Ind.-- U.S. Mike Pence discussed his political future-- in somewhat nonspecific terms-- while addressing students in a Central High School social studies class Friday. Mike Pence acknowledged he was considering maybe coming home and running for governor, but the Republican said he was likely months away from making a final decision. He didn't completely rule out seeking a seventh term representing Indiana's 6th District in the U.S. House. While it's

whether to seek the governor's position or run for re-election to his congressional seat. Mike Pence can't raise funds for a gubernatorial race until April 30- giving him plenty of Tim Pawlentye to make a decision. In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana, Mike Pence said. "We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012."
